page.title: 08CUSTOMS 1 BRAE
page.content: BRAE UP_HELLY_AA. The Brae Up_Helly_Aa takes place in early March it is an old Norse custom. It is to celebrate the passing of winter and the coming of spring. Each year a Guizer Jarl is chosen.He then selects a squad of local men to form the Jarl squad.They dress in full Viking outfits.During the day they visit local places,the school,the police station,health centre and the hotel. During the winter months a galley and torches have been made. At night the Jarl Squad heads a torch_light procession through Brae.The galley is pulled behind them.Other squads are formed.Some squads come from all over Shetland.The squads can be made up of men,women and childern.They have spent a long time making their costumes and thinking up
